{"count":450,"next_page":11,"page_size":20,"jobs":[{"id":"jobs/95603321424749254","title":"Hardware Qualification Engineer, Platforms, Google Cloud","categories":["HARDWARE_ENGINEERING"],"apply_url":"https://www.google.com/about/careers/applications/signin?jobId=CiUAL2FckYhsr2ffP7Xz6sfg6F5bNlqYrzObo-VxOBi8uxUedrzLEjsA85OaoHR82gRpyvWbERE_65uBApASC-HLzYl2bCtUgcn6MCYJneQqp9RpjKiDSc7iVoVuJJ7ExH2VKA%3D%3D_V2&jobTitle=Hardware+Qualification+Engineer&loc=US","responsibilities":"
Create test plans and coordinate resources across test environments.
Perform electrical, functional, performance and reliability testing for Google's machine learning trays and solutions. Analyze results to ensure that they meet Google's requirements.
Report bugs and drive corrective action where needed with external suppliers and internal Supply Quality Engineers (SQEs), commodity teams, and developers.
Use scopes, protocol analyzers, BERTs, and other lab equipment to collect high precision data.
Organize results, communicate findings, and incorporate learnings to maintain and improve the qualification process.
","qualifications":"Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
3 years of experience working on board-level design and testing, schematic capture and layout.
Experience with protocols and interfaces (e.g., I2C, SPI, PCIe) and with testing requirements, best practices, and algorithms.
Experience collecting and organizing data to reproduce and explain results.
Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Understanding of signal integrity, especially for high speed interfaces, and best practices to collect accurate SI data.
Familiarity with lab equipment like scopes, BERTs, and analyzers.
Ability to use scripting and automation to execute test algorithms, and then analyze results.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
","company_id":"companies/ebbbf0d1-8121-483c-8f99-ee92597591fc","company_name":"Google","language_code":"en-US","locations":[{"display":"Sunnyvale, CA, USA","lat":37.4030338,"lon":-122.0325786,"address_lines":["Google Building TC3, 805 11th Ave, Sunnyvale, CA 94089, USA"],"city":"Sunnyvale","post_code":"94089","country":"CA","country_code":"US","is_remote":false}],"description":"Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users. With your technical expertise, you lead projects in multiple areas of expertise (i.e., engineering domains or systems) within a data center facility, including construction and equipment installation/troubleshooting/debugging with vendors.
As a Hardware Qualification Engineer, you will lead initiatives to do testing for machine learning hardware deployed in Google's data centers. The Hardware Qualification team ensures that this cutting-edge equipment is reliable. In the Research and Development lab, you plan for and execute the way to test at scale. Working with design engineers, you give input on designs to improve our hardware until you're sure it meets Google's standards of quality, reliability, and security.Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.The US base salary range for this full-time position is $119,000-$181,000 + bonus + equity + benefits.
